clinical_study.brief_title: Barriers and Breakthroughs in IMPlementing Split Regimen OVEr Single Dose
clinical_study.official_title: IMPlementing Split Regimen OVEr Single Dose

brief_summary.textblock: The split-dose regimen (SpD) has demonstrated its superiority over the day-before regimen (DB) in determining a better colon cleansing and is considered the standard bowel preparation for colonoscopies by the American Society for Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE) and the European Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ESGE) guidelines. However its application is still suboptimal due to concerns about patient acceptability, fluid aspiration due to residual gastric contents and challenging viability for early morning colonoscopies. Barriers precluding the prescription of SpD have been explored in few studies mainly in the setting of auditing of current practice, while corrective measure aiming at changing this practice have been prospectively tested in very few, small and selected, cohorts. The present study has the aim of surveying split-dose regimen adoption rate among several endoscopic centres before and after an improvement phase following a plan-do-study-act approach, in order to analyse and correct factors preventing its adoption. A multivariate analysis was planned in order to use collected data to infer factors favouring and limiting split-dose regimen adoption.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants adopting a split-dose regimen in Cycle1
Number of participants adopting a split-dose regimen in Cycle2
Change from Cycle1 in the proportion of patients adopting a split-dose regimen during Cycle2 after an improvement phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: 9 months (Cycle1 = 6 months + Cycle2 = 3 months, separated by a 21-month improvement phase)

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing colonoscopy with full bowel cleansing before the improvement phase
Patients undergoing colonoscopy with full bowel cleansing after the improvement phase

study_pop.textblock: Every inpatient or outpatient undergoing a complete colonoscopy with full bowel cleansing for any indication in one of the participating centres in Central Italy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects undergoing colonoscopy with full bowel cleansing
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incapacity to give informed consent
- Partial colonoscopy
